comment: dude is a chiller. class is an easy A. no exams. weekly homework and open note quizzes on mcgraw hill. we have a few group assignments/presentations but they're easy. present a few things in a group, but theres no pressure- he will stop you and tell stories. definitely take him over any other professor for MGT 3200.

Professor Moodie is by far the best professor I have had! Although it is a lot of work he grades really lightly. There are no final exams just projects, team cases, and mini quizzes. As long as you try in his class, he will grade you well. I have only 1 B in the class and that's from the game scenarios. I highly recommend taking him. Easy A!
Very well laid out class, easy to follow along with weekly assignments, responds quickly to questions, taking him again for MGT 3200

His asynchronous Operations Management class was one of the easiest of my life. Split the case study questions up among your team, do your site visit early, and read instructions carefully. His emails and instructions aren't super clear, but once you get the hang of it you're golden. Wayyyy easier final project than other 3200 class, and no exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Took his class online, very easy and he gives you until the end of the semester to redo EVERY individual assignment for full credit. When you don't do it right, he tells you exactly how to improve the assignment. This man is such a blessing. Easy class but be prepared for some work. Great class! You don't need the textbook which is a bonus.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: 14 short quizzes (not proctored), 11 weekly group papers (easy), 7 Game Scenarios, 1 intro discussion, and a  large individual project. Work seems intimidating at first, but extremely easy. You're assigned to a group for weekly essays about project management cases. Prof grades and responds quickly, allows redos until work is perfect. TAKE HIM!!!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: One of my most favorite classes at KSU. There is a lot of work in this class, but it's all pretty easy, and he lets you redo each assignment until it's good enough to be a 100. You also get assignment results back very quickly. Sometimes within a few hours, even at 3am. No exams.

Professor Moodie was an easy grader and quick with email responses. Somewhat vague assignment instructions but he lets you resubmit until he likes everything. Weekly group and individual assignments, case studies, scenario games, and quizzes.  Easy A if you put in the time.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Although there were about 4 assignments due each week, the majority of the assignments could be redone until you got an A. It's easy to get an A in this course as long as you complete your assignments and follow his feedback. There are deadlines every week, however, you can work ahead in the course. You should take him.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Moodie is a great professor. His lectures can just be a little boring. I've had him for both undergraduate and now graduate program. The material/assignments are relatively easy. You have case studies to read and a process improvement project at the end to present. Great guy and professor, just be prepared to read a lot
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: There is a group case and an individual assignment due every week. It seems super overwhelming at first but i found that this was the easiest class i took this semester. Dr. Moodie allows you to redo your assignments until you get an A on them, and he usually tells you exactly what you need to fix. Overall I would take him again!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Moodie was a great professor but this course required a ton of work. We had 2 quizzes a week, at least 1 large homework assignment, and then a case study every week. All this took some time, but was not hard. In class he made us sign in and at the end of the semester he took off 10 points from our overall grade per class we missed.

Professor Moodie was not that bad at all. He responds on email very quickly, he just is not always extremely clear in his directions. However he is a super easy grader. Group projects or individual projects can be timely, but they are not hard. Just tedious! Put in the work and use your resources, you'll do great!
He seemed nice and he has a forgiving grading system

Prof Moodie was one of my easiest proffesors. No tests, just a group project that wasn't too hard, and weekly HW that is straight forward and doesn't take too long. 10/10 would reccomend him for an easy A.

I'm not sure why Doug has a bad rating, he is a GREAT CHOICE! He may not be the most clear in his instructions, BUT THERE ARE ZERO EXAMS IN THIS CLASS. All assignments are on connect (quizzes and homework) and are not on lockdown. Weekly group case studies and One group project but both are very easy and he will only let you get an A! TAKE HIM!
Great choice. Takes late work.
Get a good team for weekly case studies and semester project and its an easy A. Weekly hw and quizzes in connect.

Great Professor! HW and quizzes are on connect and you get 3 attempts to better your grades for the quizzes! group project that is worked on throughout the semester. Case reports that are associated with the chapters are due every week! powerpoint notes have all the information you need for hw and quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: Good professor.  Very Easy Class

Interesting fella... gives great feedback and wont let you finish an assignment until you get an A, love that mindset. Dr. Moodie definitely lacks some netiquette though. He has about 300 items of content and sends emails with no context in the middle of the night; His project videos also have inaccurate data, not to mention the hours of work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: The class is labor-intensive, but once you get the hang of it, you are good. Make sure to give yourself ample time to complete assignments. He responds quickly, and his feedback is almost instantaneous. A great class to take!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Moodie is AMAZING! There is HW, a quiz, & a group case due every week, with a group presentation of 1 case. He answers all the ques. you have doesn't matter how stupid! He genuinely wants everyone to succeed. Wish he taught more classes! There is nothing too hard. He is very reachable & even provides his cell! Only an A is possible in this class!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dont let the course load overwhelm you, most of the work is easy if you follow his instructions and examples. Pick a good team and the team cases arent too bad either. Lots of work, but if you do it and redo what he says, youll be fine. Time consuming and tedious, but not really difficult. Hes definitely something else though.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Professor Moodie I would take him again. He will not grade an assignment until it is 100% correct which is a good thing, it is hard to fail this course. He will accept late assignments with a small penalty.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Moodie is a very rude professor. One of the big parts of this class was a group presentation, but he would interrupt every group in the middle of their presentation and tell them that they were wrong. He will not grade assignments until they are perfect so you may have to redo things many times to even get a grade. Don't take this prof

Easiest class ever. Took him hybrid so only had to go once a week. Every week a group presents a project that he gives everyone an A for. Connect assignments are super easy and you can take as many times as you want. I did them all the last week in about 5 hours. Cool guy.

Non-traditional class structure. Groups selected early in the semester and the only group work you do is case study reports. There's a case study every week, and a semester long project, but its broken down into sections that you submit each week. Moodie wants everyone to pass with an A so he will let you redo assignments until you get full credit

One of the easiest classes I have ever taken. There are no tests, just 3-4 assignments every week that may be time-consuming but they are very easy. He is extremely rude and arrogant and seems to have typos in everything he types, however. I do recommend for an easy A, but you probably will not learn anything useful because it is so easy.

This class was enjoyable but you have to work hard. This professor wont let you slide by with minimal work. If you do mess up he will let you re-do it until you get it right. Some instructions are not very clear, the book is helpful with a link to examples online.

A lot of people didn't like him, but I really didn't think he was bad. His class is fairly easy, tests can be a little tricky, but he gives 3 tries. The homework is easy and all on Connect. GO TO CLASS bc attendance counts a lot in his course. If you miss over 10 classes, you cannot get an A. He is really quirky and funny in my opinion. Good choice

You have to go to class otherwise you will lose a lot of points from your overall grade, otherwise no one would go to this class. Nothing in class is relevant to the exams. He gives 3 attempts on the exams though. Easy to get an A but the class is a waste of time.

MWF 8 am class. You lose a point off of you final grade every missed class! Avoid. The work is not difficult but he is strange and calls on students non stop. 3 exams 1 Final. Group project and connect quizzes and hw. If you actually force yourself to go to every class it is an easy A. His lectures are not covered on the exams.

It wasokay for an online class but there are a lot of assignments due every week. a group case project, a quiz, a scenario, AND a part of the main project assignment. You will get an A if you complete all assignments. He does keep giving back assignments and wont give you full credit until you complete it the way he wants. lenient for due dates.

Every week there is an individual assignment, 1 quiz and a group work case a which is pretty easy if you have a good group. Choose wisely because he Will grade your group performance which will reflect on your grades. A&D case easy but time consuming. Don't wait last minute or you'll get overwhelmed. Lots of assignmentd but pretty easy overall.

Each week there is a individual assignment, a case study in group work and a quiz. There is two Microsoft project assignments that are difficult. There is also scenarios (game simulations). In class, all you will do is go over the case. Lose 10 points for each class missed. Get to redo assignments if he fails them. Can be intimidating at times.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Only buy cases book, everything for the other book can be found online. Lots of weekly assignments that can be overwhelming but the documents form the final project, so the project is easy at the end because the content is ready. Weekly group work, individual work, quizzes and graded  game scenarios. Don't procrastinate and you'll be fine!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is an easy professor as long as you do All your assignments. On a side note, He will fail you if you do not turn in one assignment, For example, the A&D tech which is one of the most challenging assignments the rest of them are fairly easy.
group tests, easy class, only showed up on test days. Easy A

He e-mails you back with one word responses, and there are two projects that you'll probably spend hours on (in the library if you don't own a PC). Aside from those things, this class is an easy A. Choose a good group, as you'll be working together a lot! Like I said in the beginning, he isn't much help, so count on your group members to help you.

Professor with great insight into how a business functions. You will learn about everything the business cases don't tell you, and the information on politics in the work environment is valuable. Gets off topic often. No tests, several online quizzes, case studies with questions, and one  project with lots of  writing. Do everything and get an A.

Get ready for Lots of Work!  None of it terribly hard, but most of it time consuming.  Stay on top of it, ask questions, and you'll do great!  if you don't do well on an assignment, ask for clarification, and he'll let you resubmit it.  Group work is done in the form of cases and a group help grade.  Really, if you don't get an "A", you didn't try.

Dr. Moodie is brilliant. He's also very personable, but he's not a great teacher. This class consisted of discussions, homework, exams, and a project. He will send back your homework til you get it right. If you just do the homework, project, and discussions, you can do poorly on the exams and still make an A.

I took this course online. His directions are VERY confusing on almost every assignment you do.  However, once you figure it out he is a VERY VERY VERY easy grader. You can do minimal work and still make an A. Don't take him if you actually want to learn something though...

Dr. Moodie is a dear, sweet professor, but he is kind of all over the place. He doesn't answer questions very well. He assigns a LOT of busy work type homework. When you ask him questions about the problems, his answers are rather ambiguous. He doesn't give study guides for his exams, so its difficult to adequately prepare for them.

Dr. Moodie did a does everything that he can to see you succeed in his class.  He will meet up with you individually, and gives you all of the opportunitiy he can.  This class has 0 exams and you have 3 chances to take each quiz.  Final project is worth 30% of your grade but if you show effort he grades pretty leniently.
pretty easy class. a lot of homework but it helps to boost your grade. I'd recommend taking him

This class is a procrastinators dream come true. No attendance & he gives you the entire semester to do the assignments.  I have a low C test average, and I will still be getting an A in the class.  No need to even study, just do the homework, discussions, and quizzes. (the answers can be found online)
Boring and too much pointless homework. He will ramble a lot. Not hard just boring.

He is a complete goofball! Most of his jokes are not funny but he tries to get everyone engaged as much as possible. If you are nice and actually talk to him, he will embarrass you less. If you don't, then he will call you out in front of the class. He tries to help as much as possible with homework, project, and even tests!

Class is an easy A if you do all your work on time and do your project. In vista he will have chapter resources with learning objectives, if you are able to complete all of the learning objectives you will be able to get a 100 on the test. Smart man too.
I like the way he tells you about the real world it makes the class a lot of fun! lots of powerpoints but it Project stuff can't be helped... TAKE HIM!!!

He teaches from power point so the class is very dry to say the least but he's a nice guy. 3 exams each worth 15% including the final(not cumulative). Make sure you get organized and get it done as quickly as possible bc the harder material is at the end of the term. Requires a lot of busy work(discussion board posts, HW assignment).

This class is not hard at all. There is just a lot of work to do, but that work helps preparing the exams. The trick is to do all the work weekly instead of waiting the last minute because it will be hard to understand. 3 attempts on quizzes, he returns hwk until u get 100,weekly discussion on vista, a group project, 3 tests. Dr Moodie is the best.
Great professor! He sends back all assignments until you get a 100.. and you get 3 chances to take each quiz! I would definitely recommend this professor!

Great professor. Accent is amusing. Read the book alot of the questions from the test are on there. Do the homeworks, they will take you 5 min if you know what your doing. If you have questions, ask him he will explain. Knows his stuff. You, will leave this class with a deeper understanding. I got an A, just read and dont be lazy.
I didn't like going to this class. Lectures are boring and the subject is dry. Moodie is a very smart guy but he teachings weren't clear. Lots of busy work..take someone else.

A lot of busy work in this course, but it's relatively painless. The exams are not bad if you do the quizzes to study (he has extra practice ones on vista...do them!). He gives you the equations for the exams and also gives back assignments until you get 100. I would recommend although he is pretty boring. The accent is entertaining though.

Doesn't cover test material in class very thoroughly, however lays out what is required VERY clearly. Here are the secrets: 1) Look at the objectives at the beginning of each chapter powerpoint. The tests will attempt to complete those objectives. 2) Do the self study quizzes posted online for each chapter. Much of the test material is from it.

Glad i not only one who was surprised by it. Was shocked to watch so many videos in a maymester class. Lectures were from old textbook's powerpoint and were material differences. Was disappointed by class. No personal experience used as examples even though had related work experience. Interesting personality, dull teaching style.

I took this class Maymester because of the reduced workload.  I found the lectures pretty much useless.  Read the book! My primary concern was that on the day of the final he spent a ridiculous amount of time helping a few students and not in a discreet manner.  It was VERY distracting and while it didn't affect my grade I'm sure it did for some.
Very smart and experienced. I took the class in maysession. I would love to have had this guy in the regular session. I absolutely loved the class.
You will teach yourself. Nice guy, but doesnt really cover test material.  Test day is like reading a foreign language.
No Comments

He's a nice guy, but a bad professor. Exams are very hard and he doesn't guide you on what to study. We actually had to retake an exam because so many people failed. You have to read the book word for word and basically teach yourself from the book.
